content.p: Programming is the act of writing instructions that a computer can follow to perform a task.
It’s how we tell machines what to do, when to do it, and how to do it — using a language they understand

ul.li: To build websites, games, or apps
To solve real-world problems using code

content.p: Computers don’t “think” the way we do. They follow step-by-step instructions precisely — even if it results in something incorrect.

ul.li: Clear: easy for humans to read ;
Precise: detailed enough for machines to follow ;

content.p: Programmings write their code in a programming language. There are many programming languages to choose from, each with its own strengths and weaknesses. Some popular languages include Python, Java, JavaScript, C++, and Ruby. Each language has its own syntax, features, and use cases.

content.p: Overall, coding is part of programming — but programming also involves thinking, planning, and problem-solving.

summary.p: Analogy: Programming is like building a house. Coding is like laying the bricks and mortar, while programming is like designing the blueprint and planning the layout.
